DOC.brief_summary: Laser situ keratomileusis ( LASIK ) photorefractive keratectomy ( PRK ) currently 2 main refractive surgery correct myopia perform worldwide , patient prefer LASIK PRK good comfort faster rehabilitation . However , post-LASIK patient , low risk flap dislodgement . This risk increase certain occupation high risk trauma . Hence , may role PRK people occupation , e.g . soldier , parachutist , sportsman . There several non-randomised study show PRK efficacious , predictable safe LASIK low moderate myope . But randomize control study compare efficacy safety 2 treatment modality study compare LASIK PRK suffer high dropout rate follow-up period . We compare efficacy , predictability , stability safety LASIK versus PRK one year duration almost 100 % attendance follow-up visit .
DOC.brief_title: Efficacy LASIK Versus PRK Asians With Mild Moderate Myopia
DOC.detailed_description: This study prospective , randomize , clinical trial compare efficacy , predictability , stability safety LASIK versus PRK volunteer group myopic military serviceman recruit Singapore Armed Forces . 132 subject eligible study randomize undergo either LASIK PRK eye 2:1 ratio . 45 subject ( 90 eye ) underwent PRK 87 subject ( 174 eye ) underwent LASIK . An additional 59 subject underwent non-randomised arm study underwent PRK .
DOC.criteria: Male female subject eligible study 18 year old old give informed consent ; stable myopia range 2.00 5.00D spherical equivalent myopia , less 2.00D refractive astigmatism determine manifest refraction least 6 month ; best correct visual acuity least 20/20 stable keratometry wear soft contact lenses least 2 week hard lens least 3 week . Study subject require minimum cornea thickness least 460um measured Orbscan pachymetry . Subjects exclude corneal anterior segment pathology , myopic peripheral retinal degeneration myopic macular degeneration ; clinical sign progressive unstable myopia keratoconus keratoconus suspect ; oneeyed patient ; undergone previous ocular surgery ; history herpes zoster ophthalmicus herpes simplex keratitis ; history steroidresponsive rise intraocular pressure preoperative intraocular pressure 21 mmHg either eye ; diabetes mellitus , autoimmune disease , severe dry eye , connective tissue disease significant atopy ; chronic systemic corticosteroid immunosuppressive therapy ; cornea thickness would result less 250 micron remain posterior corneal thickness flap postoperatively central corneal endothelial cell count less 1500 cells/mm2 either eye
